definitions: A Buddhist monastery or temple where monks reside and practice rituals.
examples: हामी गुम्बामा प्रार्थना गर्न र बौद्ध धर्मका शिक्षा सिक्न गयौँ।
examplesRomanized: hami gumbama prarthana garna ra bauddha dharmaka siksha sikna gayaun.
exampleEnglish: We went to the monastery to pray and learn about Buddhist teachings.

definitions: A Hindu temple where devotees perform rituals, offer prayers, and celebrate festivals.
examples: हामी दीपावलीको अवसरमा मन्दिरमा पूजा गर्न गयौँ।
examplesRomanized: hami deepawaliko avasarma mandirma puja garna gayaun.
exampleEnglish: We went to the temple during Diwali to perform worship.

definitions: A mosque; a place where Muslims gather for prayers, sermons, and religious events.
examples: हाम्रो छिमेकमा प्रत्येक शुक्रबार मस्जिदमा विशेष नमाज हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: hamro chimekma pratyek shukrabar masjidma vishesh namaz hunchha.
exampleEnglish: In our neighborhood, there is a special prayer at the mosque every Friday.

definitions: A Christian place of worship where people gather for prayers, sermons, and ceremonies.
examples: सन्तुको जन्मदिनमा चर्चमा विशेष प्रार्थना गरियो।
examplesRomanized: santuko janmadinma churchma vishesh prarthana gario.
exampleEnglish: A special prayer was held at the church for the saint's birthday.

definitions: A religious ritual or worship, typically involving offerings, prayers, and devotion to a deity.
examples: घरमा बिहान साँझ देवीको पूजा नियमित रूपमा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: gharma bihan sanjh deviko puja niyamit rupma garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Daily worship of the goddess is performed morning and evening at home.

definitions: A sacred pilgrimage site visited by devotees for spiritual merit and religious practices.
examples: हर वर्ष हजारौँ भक्त रामेछापको तीर्थ यात्रा गर्न जान्छन्।
examplesRomanized: har barsha hajaraun bhakta ramechapko tirtha yatra garna janchhan.
exampleEnglish: Every year, thousands of devotees go on a pilgrimage to Ramechap.

definitions: A form of ritualistic prayer or offering, usually involving recitation of deity names.
examples: पिताजीले हरेक सोमबार भगवानको अर्चना गर्नुहुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: pitaji le harek sombar bhagwanko archana garnuhunchha.
exampleEnglish: Father performs ritualistic prayers to God every Monday.

definitions: A devotional song sung in praise of a deity.
examples: संध्यामा परिवारसँग भजन गाउने चलन छ।
examplesRomanized: sandhyama parivarsang bhajan gaune chalan chha.
exampleEnglish: It is customary to sing devotional songs with the family in the evening.

definitions: A sacred utterance, word, or phrase repeated during prayers or meditation.
examples: प्रत्येक बिहान उनले 'ओम नमः शिवाय' मन्त्र जप गर्नुहुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: pratyek bihan unle 'Om Namah Shivaya' mantra jap garnuhunchha.
exampleEnglish: Every morning, he chants the 'Om Namah Shivaya' mantra.

definitions: Sacred food or offering distributed to devotees after worship.
examples: मन्दिरमा प्रसाद ग्रहण गर्दा सबै खुशी भए।
examplesRomanized: mandirma prasad grahan garda sabai khushi bhaye.
exampleEnglish: Everyone was happy receiving sacred offerings at the temple.

definitions: The state of being holy, pure, or sacred.
examples: तीर्थस्थलको पवित्रता अनुभव गर्न यहाँ धेरै भक्त आउँछन्।
examplesRomanized: tirthasthal ko pavitrata anubhav garna yaha dherai bhakta aunchhan.
exampleEnglish: Many devotees come here to experience the holiness of the pilgrimage site.

definitions: A Hindu ritual or rite of passage performed at different stages of life.
examples: नवजात शिशुको नामकरण संस्कार मन्दिरमा भयो।
examplesRomanized: navajat shishuko namkaran sanskar mandirma bhayo.
exampleEnglish: The naming ceremony of the newborn took place at the temple.

definitions: Silent meditation or spiritual practice focusing on inner peace.
examples: भिक्षुले जंगलमा मौन साधना गर्नुभयो।
examplesRomanized: bhikshule jangalma maun sadhana garnubhayo.
exampleEnglish: The monk practiced silent meditation in the forest.

definitions: The holy book of Islam containing revelations given to Prophet Muhammad.
examples: मस्जिदमा कुरानको पाठ भयो।
examplesRomanized: masjidma quran ko path bhayo.
exampleEnglish: The Quran was recited in the mosque.

definitions: The holy scripture of Christians containing teachings of Jesus and prophets.
examples: हामीले चर्चमा बाइबलको अध्ययन गर्यौं।
examplesRomanized: hamile churchma bible ko adhyayan garyau.
exampleEnglish: We studied the Bible at the church.

definitions: A form of nonviolent resistance or spiritual truth-force practice.
examples: महात्मा गान्धीले सत्याग्रहको माध्यमबाट आन्दोलन गरे।
examplesRomanized: mahatma gandhile satyagrah ko madhyam bata andolan gare.
exampleEnglish: Mahatma Gandhi led the movement through nonviolent resistance.

definitions: A deity or god worshipped in various religions.
examples: हामीले मन्दिरमा विष्णु देवताको पूजा गर्यौं।
examplesRomanized: hamile mandirma Vishnu devtako puja garyau.
exampleEnglish: We worshipped Lord Vishnu at the temple.

definitions: A ritual of worship involving waving lighted lamps in front of a deity.
examples: हरेक साँझ मन्दिरमा आरती गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: harek sanjh mandirma aarti garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Aarti is performed at the temple every evening.

definitions: A holy man or ascetic who practices spiritual discipline.
examples: साधुले सडकमा भिक्षाटन गर्दै जीवनयापन गर्नुहुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: sadhule sadakma bhikshatan gardai jivanyapan garnuhunchha.
exampleEnglish: The holy man survives by seeking alms on the street.

definitions: A spiritual and physical practice to attain mental and bodily discipline.
examples: हरेक बिहान उनले योग अभ्यास गर्नुहुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: harek bihan unle yoga abhyas garnuhunchha.
exampleEnglish: Every morning, he practices yoga.

definitions: A religious fast observed for spiritual purification or devotion.
examples: महिला हरेक सोमबार उपवास बस्छन्।
examplesRomanized: mahila harek sombar upvas baschhan.
exampleEnglish: Women observe a fast every Monday.

definitions: The act of seeking alms or donations as a religious practice.
examples: भिक्षु भिक्षाटनका लागि गाउँमा गए।
examplesRomanized: bhikshu bhikshatan ka lagi gaunma gaye.
exampleEnglish: The monk went to the village to seek alms.

definitions: Seeking refuge or protection, often from a deity or spiritual guide.
examples: भक्तहरूले भगवानको शरणमा जाने विश्वास गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: bhaktaharule bhagwanko sharanma jane bishwas garchhan.
exampleEnglish: Devotees believe in seeking refuge with God.

definitions: The repeated chanting of a sacred mantra for spiritual benefits.
examples: भिक्षुले ध्यानको समयमा मंत्रजप गर्नुहुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: bhikshule dhyan ko samaya mantra jap garnuhunchha.
exampleEnglish: The monk chants mantras during meditation.

definitions: Liberation from the cycle of birth and death; spiritual salvation.
examples: योग र ध्यानमार्फत मानिसले मोक्ष प्राप्त गर्न सक्छ।
examplesRomanized: yog ra dhyan marfat manisle moksha prapt garna sakchha.
exampleEnglish: Through yoga and meditation, one can achieve liberation.

definitions: A festival celebrated with religious significance.
examples: दशैं नेपालीहरूको प्रमुख धार्मिक पर्व हो।
examplesRomanized: Dashain Nepalikoharu ko pramukh dharmik parv ho.
exampleEnglish: Dashain is the main religious festival of Nepalis.

definitions: Stories or legends told during a fast to inspire devotion and moral lessons.
examples: महिला व्रत बसेर व्रतकथा सुन्ने चलन छ।
examplesRomanized: mahila vrat basera vratkatha sunne chalan chha.
exampleEnglish: Women observe fasts and listen to sacred stories.

definitions: The principle of nonviolence toward all living beings.
examples: गान्धीजीले अहिंसाको मार्ग अपनाउनुभयो।
examplesRomanized: Gandhiji le ahimsako marg apnanu bhayo.
exampleEnglish: Gandhi adopted the path of nonviolence.

definitions: A spiritually enlightened person or saint.
examples: संतको उपदेशले भक्तहरूको जीवन बदलिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: sant ko upadesh le bhaktaharu ko jivan badlinchha.
exampleEnglish: A saint’s teachings transform the lives of devotees.

definitions: A cremation ground where the dead are cremated according to Hindu rituals.
examples: श्मशानमा पिताको अन्तिम संस्कार गरियो।
examplesRomanized: shamshanma pitako antim sanskar gariyo.
exampleEnglish: Father's final rites were performed at the cremation ground.

definitions: Holy water used in religious rituals for purification.
examples: मन्दिरको मूर्तिमा पवित्र जल चढाइयो।
examplesRomanized: mandir ko murti ma pavitra jal chadhaio.
exampleEnglish: Holy water was sprinkled on the temple idol.

definitions: A spiritual gathering where devotees listen to discourses or chant together.
examples: हामीले सत्संगमा भगवद् गीता सुने।
examplesRomanized: hamile satsangma Bhagavad Gita sune.
exampleEnglish: We listened to the Bhagavad Gita at the spiritual gathering.

definitions: Austerity or penance performed for spiritual growth or devotion.
examples: भिक्षुले हिमालमा तपस्या गर्नुभयो।
examplesRomanized: bhikshule himalma tapasya garnubhayo.
exampleEnglish: The monk performed penance in the mountains.

definitions: Spiritual practice or discipline aimed at self-realization and devotion.
examples: शिवभक्त हरेक दिन साधना गर्नुहुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: Shivbhakt harek din sadhana garnuhunchha.
exampleEnglish: The devotee of Shiva practices spiritual discipline daily.

definitions: A religious sermon or discourse delivered by a spiritual teacher.
examples: पंडितजीले मन्दिरमा प्रवचन दिनुभयो।
examplesRomanized: panditji le mandirma pravachan dinubhayo.
exampleEnglish: The priest delivered a sermon at the temple.

definitions: A place designated for observing religious fasts and rituals.
examples: महिलाहरू व्रतस्थलीमा व्रत बस्न आउँछन्।
examplesRomanized: mahilaharu vratasthali ma vrat basna aunchhan.
exampleEnglish: Women come to the fasting site to observe their vows.

definitions: The act of seeing or being in the presence of a deity for blessings.
examples: हामी मन्दिरमा भगवानको दर्शन गर्न गयौँ।
examplesRomanized: hami mandirma bhagwanko darshan garna gayaun.
exampleEnglish: We went to the temple to have a glimpse of the deity.

definitions: Advice or teachings given by a spiritual teacher or elder.
examples: बाबाको उपदेशले मेरो जीवन बदलियो।
examplesRomanized: baba ko upadesh le mero jivan badliyo.
exampleEnglish: Father's guidance changed my life.

definitions: The state of being spiritually joyful or content, often as a result of devotion.
examples: पूजा गरेपछि भक्तको मनमा प्रसन्नता हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: puja garepachi bhaktako manma prasannata hunchha.
exampleEnglish: After performing worship, the devotee feels joy in their heart.

definitions: A religious ceremony or ritual performed according to tradition.
examples: शादीको अवसरमा धार्मिक अनुष्ठान सम्पन्न भयो।
examplesRomanized: shadiko avasarma dharmik anushthan sampanna bhayo.
exampleEnglish: A religious ceremony was performed during the wedding.

definitions: Hearing the teachings or stories of saints to gain spiritual knowledge.
examples: हामीले सत्संगमा सन्तानश्रवण गर्यौं।
examplesRomanized: hamile satsangma santanshravan garyau.
exampleEnglish: We listened to saintly teachings at the spiritual gathering.

definitions: Religious discipline or adherence to spiritual rules and moral conduct.
examples: भक्तले जीवनभर धार्मिक अनुशासन पालना गर्नुपर्छ।
examplesRomanized: bhaktale jivanbhar dharmik anushasan palana garnu parchha.
exampleEnglish: A devotee must maintain religious discipline throughout life.

definitions: A person who protects, promotes, or preserves religious teachings and practices.
examples: पंडितजी धर्मपालकको रूपमा चर्चमा कार्यरत हुनुहुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: panditji dharmapalakko roopma churchma karyarat hunuhunchha.
exampleEnglish: The priest works as a guardian of religious traditions in the church.

definitions: The eightfold path of yoga, focusing on ethical, physical, and spiritual practices for liberation.
examples: योग गुरुले हामीलाई अष्टांग योग सिकाउनुभयो।
examplesRomanized: yog guru le hamilai ashtang yoga sikaunubhayo.
exampleEnglish: The yoga teacher taught us the eightfold path of yoga.

definitions: A method or procedure prescribed by religious tradition for performing rituals.
examples: सन्तले धार्मिक विधि अनुसार पूजा सञ्चालन गर्नुभयो।
examplesRomanized: sant le dharmik vidhi anusaar puja sanchalan garnubhayo.
exampleEnglish: The saint conducted the worship according to religious procedure.

definitions: The eighth day of the lunar fortnight, considered auspicious for certain religious observances.
examples: नवरात्रिको अष्टमीमा विशेष पूजा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: navaratriko ashtami ma vishesh puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Special worship is performed on the eighth day of Navaratri.

definitions: The ninth day of the lunar fortnight, significant in Hindu religious rituals.
examples: दशैँको नवमीमा घोडा मेला आयोजना हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: dashain ko navami ma ghoda mela aayojana hunchha.
exampleEnglish: A horse fair is held on the ninth day of Dashain.

definitions: A Hindu festival day considered highly auspicious for starting new ventures and religious rituals.
examples: अक्षय तृतीयामा घरमा विशेष पूजा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: akshaya tritiya ma gharma vishesh puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Special worship is conducted at home on Akshaya Tritiya.

definitions: The act of repeating a mantra or divine name as a form of devotion.
examples: साधुले 'राम' शब्दको जप गर्दै ध्यान गर्नुभयो।
examplesRomanized: sadhule 'Ram' shabda ko jap gardai dhyan garnubhayo.
exampleEnglish: The ascetic meditated while chanting the name 'Ram'.

definitions: Incense burned during religious rituals to purify the surroundings and create a sacred atmosphere.
examples: मन्दिरमा धूप बालेर पूजा आरम्भ गरियो।
examplesRomanized: mandirma dhup balera puja aarambh gariyo.
exampleEnglish: Worship began at the temple with incense burning.

definitions: A bell used in temples during worship to invoke divine presence.
examples: भक्तले मन्दिरमा पूजा गर्दा घण्टी बजाए।
examplesRomanized: bhaktale mandirma puja garda ghanti bajaye.
exampleEnglish: Devotees rang the bell while performing worship at the temple.

definitions: The seventh day of the lunar fortnight, often observed for religious significance.
examples: सप्तमीका दिन विशेष पूजा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: saptami ka din vishesh puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Special worship is performed on the seventh day of the lunar cycle.

definitions: A sacred water tank or pond used in Hindu rituals for purification and offerings.
examples: मन्दिरको कुंडमा भक्तजनले स्नान गरे।
examplesRomanized: mandir ko kund ma bhaktajan le snaan gare.
exampleEnglish: Devotees bathed in the temple's sacred water tank.

definitions: A symbolic representation of Lord Shiva used for worship in Hindu temples.
examples: भक्तजनले शिवलिंगमा जल चढाए।
examplesRomanized: bhaktajan le shivaling ma jal chadhae.
exampleEnglish: Devotees offered water to the Shiva lingam.

definitions: A ritual offering, usually of water, milk, or flowers, to a deity or sacred river.
examples: भक्तजनले विष्णुलाई अर्घ्य अर्पण गरे।
examplesRomanized: bhaktajan le Vishnu lai arghya arpan gare.
exampleEnglish: Devotees offered water and flowers to Lord Vishnu.

definitions: A ritual bath or cleansing performed for purification during auspicious festivals.
examples: स्नानगृहमा धनुरास्नान गरियो।
examplesRomanized: snanagriha ma dhanurasnan gariyo.
exampleEnglish: A ritual cleansing bath was performed in the bathing area.

definitions: A set of eight hymns or verses chanted during religious rituals.
examples: भक्तजनले हरेक बिहान अष्टकको पाठ गरे।
examplesRomanized: bhaktajan le harek bihan ashtak ko path gare.
exampleEnglish: Devotees recited eight verses every morning.

definitions: A platform or stage in temples where prayers, chants, or sermons are conducted.
examples: मन्दिरमा प्रार्थना मञ्च तयार पारियो।
examplesRomanized: mandir ma prarthana manch tayar pariyo.
exampleEnglish: A prayer stage was prepared in the temple.

definitions: A regular weekly worship ceremony performed by devotees.
examples: हरेक शुक्रबार मन्दिरमा साप्ताहिक पूजा हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: harek shukrabar mandir ma saptahik puja hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Weekly worship is held at the temple every Friday.

definitions: A ritual offering made with rice or other items shaped like a small mound, often used in ancestral rites.
examples: पिताजीले पूजामा कपालको पिण्ड अर्पण गर्नुभयो।
examplesRomanized: pitaji le puja ma kapalko pind arpan garnubhayo.
exampleEnglish: Father offered a small rice mound as part of the ritual.

definitions: A sacred image or idol used during ritual bathing ceremonies.
examples: स्नानमूर्तिलाई पवित्र जलले स्नान गराइयो।
examplesRomanized: snanmurti lai pavitra jal le snan garaiyo.
exampleEnglish: The sacred idol was bathed with holy water.

definitions: A container or holder used for burning incense during religious rituals.
examples: मन्दिरमा धूपधानीमा धूप बालियो।
examplesRomanized: mandir ma dhupdhani ma dhup balio.
exampleEnglish: Incense was burned in the holder at the temple.

definitions: A ritual bathing of a deity’s idol with water, milk, honey, or other sacred substances.
examples: शिवलिंगमा अभिषेक गरियो।
examplesRomanized: shivaling ma abhishek gariyo.
exampleEnglish: The Shiva lingam was bathed in a ritual ceremony.

definitions: The lighting of lamps during worship to signify divine presence and enlightenment.
examples: मन्दिरमा दीप प्रज्वलन गरेर पूजा सुरु गरियो।
examplesRomanized: mandir ma deep prajwalan gare ra puja suru gariyo.
exampleEnglish: Worship began by lighting lamps in the temple.

definitions: A religious flag or banner used in temples or during festivals to signify sanctity.
examples: मन्दिरको छतमा रंगीन ध्वज फहराइयो।
examplesRomanized: mandir ko chhatma rangeen dhwaj phaharaiyo.
exampleEnglish: A colorful flag was hoisted on the temple roof.

definitions: A sacred fire pit used to perform Vedic fire rituals (havan) with offerings.
examples: विवाह समारोहमा हवन कुंडमा अग्नि पूजा गरियो।
examplesRomanized: vivah samaroha ma havan kund ma agni puja gariyo.
exampleEnglish: A fire ritual was performed in the sacred fire pit during the wedding ceremony.

definitions: A ritual of offering water or food to ancestors to honor them.
examples: पितृ पक्षको दिन हामीले तर्पण गर्यौं।
examplesRomanized: pitru paksha ko din hamile tarpan garyau.
exampleEnglish: We performed offerings to ancestors on the day of Pitru Paksha.

definitions: Precious items like flowers, fruits, or coins used in religious offerings.
examples: पूजामा मूल्यवान सामग्री चढाइयो।
examplesRomanized: puja ma mulyawan samagri chadhaio.
exampleEnglish: Precious items were offered during the worship.

definitions: The seven sacred steps taken by a couple around the holy fire during Hindu weddings.
examples: विवाहमा दुलही-दुलहाले सप्तपदी पूरा गरे।
examplesRomanized: vivah ma dulahi-dulhale saptapadi pura gare.
exampleEnglish: The bride and groom completed the seven sacred steps in the wedding ceremony.

definitions: A lamp used specifically for performing aarti, a ritual of waving light before a deity.
examples: पंडितजीले आरती दीप घुमाएर पूजा गर्यौं।
examplesRomanized: panditji le aarti deep ghumayera puja garyau.
exampleEnglish: The priest performed worship by waving the lamp before the deity.

definitions: A Hindu festival marking the beginning of Diwali, associated with wealth and prosperity.
examples: धनतेरसमा सबैले मन्दिरमा पूजा गर्न गयौँ।
examplesRomanized: dhanteras ma sabai le mandirma puja garna gayaun.
exampleEnglish: On Dhanteras, everyone went to the temple to offer prayers.

definitions: A sacred site or footprint associated with Lord Vishnu, often a place of pilgrimage.
examples: हजारौं भक्तजन विष्णुपदको दर्शन गर्न आउँछन्।
examplesRomanized: hajaraun bhaktajan vishnupad ko darshan garna aunchhan.
exampleEnglish: Thousands of devotees come to see the sacred Vishnu footprint.

definitions: A sound instrument, such as a bell or gong, used in temples to accompany rituals.
examples: भक्तजनले पूजा आरम्भ गर्न ध्वनि यंत्र बजाए।
examplesRomanized: bhaktajan le puja aarambh garna dhwani yantra bajaye.
exampleEnglish: Devotees rang the sound instrument to begin the worship.

definitions: Vegetarian food offered to deities during religious rituals.
examples: पूजामा शाकाहारी भोग चढाइयो।
examplesRomanized: puja ma shakahari bhog chadhaio.
exampleEnglish: Vegetarian offerings were presented during the worship.

definitions: A ritual worship of snakes, especially during Nag Panchami festival.
examples: भक्तजनले नाग पञ्चमीमा सर्प पूजा गरे।
examplesRomanized: bhaktajan le nag panchami ma sarp puja gare.
exampleEnglish: Devotees performed snake worship during Nag Panchami.

definitions: The fourteenth day of the lunar fortnight, observed with religious significance in Hindu rituals.
examples: चतुर्दशीमा विशेष रात्रि पूजा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: chaturdashi ma vishesh raatri puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Special night worship is performed on Chaturdashi.

definitions: Teachings or sayings of a spiritual teacher imparted to disciples.
examples: शिष्यले गुरु वाणी सुन्दै ध्यान गर्नुभयो।
examplesRomanized: shishya le guru vani sundai dhyan garnubhayo.
exampleEnglish: The disciple meditated while listening to the guru’s teachings.

definitions: Recitation of eight chapters of a sacred text as part of ritual practice.
examples: भक्तजनले अष्टाध्यायी पाठ गरेर पूजा आरम्भ गरे।
examplesRomanized: bhaktajan le ashtadhyayi path gare ra puja aarambh gare.
exampleEnglish: Devotees began the worship by reciting eight chapters.

definitions: A chariot procession conducted during Dashain/Dussehra festival for deity worship.
examples: गाउँमा दशहरा रथयात्रा आयोजना भयो।
examplesRomanized: gaun ma dashahara rathyatra aayojana bhayo.
exampleEnglish: A chariot procession was organized in the village during Dashain.

definitions: The chanting or recitation of verses from the Vedas as part of rituals.
examples: पुरोहितले मन्दिरमा वेद पाठ गर्नुभयो।
examplesRomanized: purohit le mandir ma ved path garnubhayo.
exampleEnglish: The priest recited Vedic verses in the temple.

definitions: A fortnight in the Hindu lunar calendar dedicated to honoring ancestors with offerings.
examples: पितृ पक्षको समयमा हामीले पूजामा तर्पण गर्यौं।
examplesRomanized: pitru paksha ko samaya ma hamile puja ma tarpan garyau.
exampleEnglish: During Pitru Paksha, we offered rituals to honor our ancestors.

definitions: A symbolic idol or figure representing a deity, used in worship.
examples: मन्दिरमा प्रतीकात्मक मूर्ति राखिएको छ।
examplesRomanized: mandir ma pratikatmak murti rakhieko chha.
exampleEnglish: A symbolic idol is placed in the temple for worship.
